intro: Eriocaulon atratum var. major, commonly known as the black rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and cylindrical inflorescences that bear small, spike-like flowers. Native to wetland and swampy habitats, this plant thrives in moist, acidic soils. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. The plant is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to tolerate and remediate contaminated environments.
